intro: Epilobium royleanum, commonly known as the Kashmir willow, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, mountainous environments and is often found near streams or in alpine meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Epilobium royleanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
